newsitem.title: NORWAY: Nycomed in deal with U.S. drugs firm.
newsitem.headline: Nycomed in deal with U.S. drugs firm.

text.p: Norwegian drugs company Nycomed ASA said on Tuesday it entered into a licensing agreement with Targeted Diagnostics and Therapeutics (TDT) of the United States to develop TDT's proprietary technology for both imaging and therapeutic applications to colorectal cancer.

Under the agreement, Nycomed has obtained exclusive worldwide rights to develop and market products in return for an up-front payment, licence fees and milestone payments potentially totalling $21 million, Nycomed said in a statement.
TDT will receive royalties on marketed products arising from the agreement.
Nycomed and TDT will collaborate on the development of imaging agents for staging of colorectal cancer as well as therapeutic agents for the treatment of metastatic disease of colorectal origin.
Both indications address significant currently unmet medical needs, Nycomed said.
According to the American Cancer Society, an estimated 130,000 new cases of colorectal cancer will be diagnosed in 1997, and nearly 55,000 people will die from the disease.

Surpassing both breast cancer and prostate cancer in mortality, colorectal cancer is second only to lung cancer in terms of numbers of deaths in the United States. Only 7 percent of all patients diagnosed with distant metastasis from colorectal cancer survive for more than five years.
Nycomed on July 1 announced plans to merge with Britain's Amersham International Plc.
